page.title: 19BUTSER HILL
page.content: The steep slopes of Butser Hill,(270ms high)are a distinctive local feature. One of the chalk hills of the South Downs escarpment,on its flat top are a wireless station,a beacon & a triangu- lation point as well as facilities for the Country Park & some Neolithic ear- thworks.The hill is let for grazing to a local farmer,who keeps rare cattle & sheep here. The Country Park has a car park just below the summit(cost 40p),a round building designed to resemble an Iron Age hut which houses a small cafe & souvenir shop & toilets,& a number of waymarked foot & bridle paths.The beacon is used to signal important national events;one has been here for hundreds of years.On the northern slopes is an Iron Age farm run as a research project.This is getting yields that are as high as those of the local'agribusiness'farmers.
